creator: jwkaltz@apache.org
text:
The stylesheet xslt/xhtml2xhtml.xsl has a template match for xhtml:object in
which the alt attribute is set to the name attribute of the xhtml:object. But,
the object does not have a name attribute. Instead, the title attribute should
presumably be used.

Proposed fix: edit the file xslt/xhtml2xhtml.xsl. In the template match starting
at line 83, replace occurrences of @name with @title

I think the first comment contains a precise definition of a patch:
"edit the file xslt/xhtml2xhtml.xsl. In the template match starting at line 83, 
replace occurrences of @name with @title"
creator: A.Kuckartz@ping.de

text:
there is a name attribute in the schema, but for some reason it does not show
up. applied your patch.
creator: gregor@apache.org
